content:
In the Da Vinci Formulary IG, we have a profile on InsurancePlan, that should largely mirror that of Plan-net (not all of the same constraints, but the same where possible). To that end, we want to use the InsuranceProduct VS and CS from Plan-net bound to InsurancePlan.type, However we are getting a ValueSet error on the profile (Canonical URL 'http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex-plan-net/ValueSet/InsuranceProductTypeVS' does not resolve):
https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-pdex-formulary/branches/stu2-draft/qa.html#_scratch_ig-build-temp-3EQ0ET_repo_fsh-generated_resources_StructureDefinition-usdf-PayerInsurancePlan

and a CodeSystem error on the examples: (Unknown Code System 'http://hl7.org/fhir/us/davinci-pdex-plan-net/CodeSystem/InsuranceProductTypeCS')
https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-pdex-formulary/branches/stu2-draft/qa.html#_scratch_ig-build-temp-3EQ0ET_repo_fsh-generated_resources_InsurancePlan-PayerInsurancePlanA1002

Is there something specific that has to be done to include ValueSets and CodeSystems from other IGs?
Have you declared a dependency on the plan-net IG?
I was pretty sure I did that, but got errors doing so. Perhaps it was in the midst of my certificate errors I was dealing with. That issue seems resolved.
Corey Spears has marked this topic as resolved.
Another newb question here. I am experiencing these types of errors. The IG I am working on depends on US Core. Where do I declare this dependency using Sushi?
in sushi-config.yml. read the SUSHI documentation on dependencies here: https://fshschool.org/docs/sushi/configuration/#dependencies

Yep, got it. We dont currently have a sushi-config.yml file, so I first tried to declare it in the IG resource like:

  <dependsOn>
    <uri value="http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.us.core"/>
    <version value="4.0.0"/>
  </dependsOn>

which worked to resolve the dependency.

I am wondering how far we can get without sushi-config.yml?

We also have a dependency on the Synthea IG. Anyone know the uri for that?

The IG Sushi project is here
https://github.com/synthetichealth/synthea-fhir-ig/blob/master/fsh/config.yaml

When I add this (I have tried a number of different combinations):

  <dependsOn>
    <uri value="http://synthetichealth.github.io/synthea/ImplementationGuide/synthea.fhir"/>
    <version value="1.0.0"/>
  </dependsOn>

I get:

Package Id for guide at http://synthetichealth.github.io/synthea is unknown (contact FHIR Product Director
has that guide actually been published anywhere?

Jean Duteau said:

has that guide actually been published anywhere?

Not sure, @Jean Duteau . I dont see it listed here: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FHIR/ig-registry/master/fhir-ig-list.json
Maybe someone from MITRE or the FHIR Product Director @Grahame Grieve can shed some light.
that will be your problem - if it hasn't been published and a NPM package isn't made available, then you can't depend on it since there is nothing for the publisher to use to understand
Where does publisher look? Can we publish the IG locally and point to it?
yes you can. But synthea isn't really producing an IG. Why would you like to depend on it?

Grahame Grieve said:

yes you can. But synthea isn't really producing an IG. Why would you like to depend on it?

They actually did produce a small IG that profiled the Patient resource. They just apparently never published it:

https://github.com/synthetichealth/synthea-fhir-ig
Interesting. You want to depend on an IG that isn't published? There is something you can do locally on your dev box. or you can clone the repo, and set it up and publish it yourself

Grahame Grieve said:

Interesting. You want to depend on an IG that isn't published? There is something you can do locally on your dev box. or you can clone the repo, and set it up and publish it yourself

I entered an issue on the synthea github for Mitre to publish it. In the meantime, we removed the dependency. I think there is a misunderstanding in the community at large about what these IGs signify and why they should be published. I think this is largely due to IP related concerns, not in the case of MITRE, but definitely in the case of other vendors.
